summary: A video interview featuring singer Marc Martel, known for his vocal resemblance to Freddie Mercury, discussing his career journey, contributions to the film Bohemian Rhapsody, and performing live.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a blue background featuring a circular logo that reads 'The Cafe' in white cursive text, surrounded by a blue border and a spoon graphic at the bottom. The scene transitions to a cozy, well-decorated room where a man wearing headphones is seated at a piano, singing into a microphone. The room is adorned with string lights, a lamp, and various decorative items, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The man is dressed in a black t-shirt and appears to be deeply engaged in his performance. The video then shifts to a woman with blonde hair, wearing a floral-patterned blouse, who is speaking in front of a television screen displaying a live performance. The television screen shows a band playing on stage, with vibrant lighting and a festive ambiance. The woman is accessorized with a necklace and earrings, and she seems to be providing commentary or hosting a segment related to the performance. The video maintains a consistent theme of music and entertainment, with a focus on both live performances and commentary.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with male tenor vocals, singing with clear, passionate tones to an emotional ballad, led by a piano melody and subtle strings. The music abruptly stops as a female speaker enthusiastically states that the song "tickles down the spine," introducing the next guest, who was selected by Brian May and Roger Taylor to voice Freddy Mercury. Her audition received 14 million YouTube views, resulting in a performance on Ellen, extensive touring, and a performance for Celine Dion. The man was hand-picked as the voice of Freddy in the movie Bohemian Rhapsody. The female speaker introduces Mark Martel, welcoming him to the show.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a lively talk show set in a cozy studio adorned with plants and a warm ambiance. Three individuals are seated at a table, engaging in a dynamic conversation. The man on the left, dressed in a dark suit, listens attentively, while the woman in the middle, wearing a floral dress, speaks animatedly, gesturing with her hands. The man on the right, clad in a black leather jacket, responds with enthusiasm, his expressions ranging from smiles to laughter. Behind them, a large screen displays a live feed of another man in a recording studio, wearing headphones and singing into a microphone, adding a layer of interaction to the scene. The text "The Cafe" is visible in the bottom left corner, indicating the name of the show. The atmosphere is casual and engaging, with the participants appearing relaxed and enjoying the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with an expression of gratitude from a male speaker, saying "Thanks for having me, I'm so excited to be here". A female speaker responds warmly, "It is so nice to have you here". She refers to "that little video then", mentioning it gave her chills and praising the music within it as beautiful. The male speaker expresses that this was "the desired reaction". The female speaker acknowledges the reaction, and a short musical interlude begins.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with three individuals seated at a table. The man on the left, dressed in a dark suit, is attentively listening, while the woman in the middle, wearing a floral-patterned blouse, is actively engaged in conversation, gesturing with her hands. The man on the right, clad in a black leather jacket, is also participating in the discussion. The background is adorned with shelves containing potted plants and decorative items, creating a cozy atmosphere. A television screen behind them displays an image of a person on stage, possibly related to the topic of discussion. The text "The Cafe" is visible in the lower left corner, indicating the name of the show. As the conversation progresses, the man in the leather jacket speaks, with the text "MARC MARTEL 'The Ultimate Queen Celebration'" appearing on the screen, identifying him and the subject of his discussion. The setting remains consistent throughout, with the participants actively engaging in the dialogue, contributing to the dynamic and interactive nature of the talk show.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female interviewer speaking in an inquisitive tone. She acknowledges the speaker as a singer in his own right before fame, noting his resemblance to Freddie Mercury. She asks about his life before the comparison. A male speaker responds in a conversational tone, describing being in a band with the usual experiences of musicians: traveling in a van and sometimes sleeping in it overnight. He recalls "slogging it out" for almost fifteen years until the "Queen thing started."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black leather jacket with quilted shoulders and a black shirt, seated in a studio setting with a backdrop of shelves adorned with potted plants. The man is engaged in a conversation, gesturing with his hands and occasionally looking to his left. The studio environment is modern and well-lit, with a warm ambiance created by the soft lighting and the presence of greenery. The logo "The Cafe" is visible in the bottom left corner of the screen, indicating the name of the show or segment. The man appears to be the focal point of the discussion, with the camera capturing his expressions and movements as he speaks. The overall atmosphere is casual and conversational, typical of a talk show or interview format.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a conversational tone, where one speaker asks another whether their voice is natural or a product of nurture, such as if they were told they sound like "Freddie" or if there was characterization. The speaker replies that it's a "little bit of both", explaining that they learned to sing by imitating, having a natural ear for mimicry, then goes on to reference Quebec and Celine. The speaker jokes about the name drop, and shares that growing up, they had "the propensity to try to imitate" what they heard and that George Michael was a big influence. The speaker notes that as their voice matured, they began to receive comparisons to Freddie Mercury even before they were familiar with more than their three biggest hits. Someone responds that this is "quite an extraordinary" thing.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with three individuals seated at a table. The woman in the center, wearing a patterned dress, is actively engaged in conversation, gesturing with her hands. To her left, a man in a dark suit listens attentively, while to her right, another man in a black leather jacket appears to be speaking. The background is decorated with plants and shelves, creating a cozy atmosphere. A television screen behind them displays an image of a man in a red jacket. The logo "The Cafe" is visible in the bottom left corner, indicating the name of the show. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man in the leather jacket, who continues to speak, with the background featuring potted plants and a warm, inviting ambiance. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, focusing on the interaction between the hosts and the guest.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker inquiring whether, at the beginning of his career, the other speaker tried to sound less like Freddy Mercury. A male speaker responds that he tried not to sound like him, adding that this became a joke. He says he would tell his bandmates he would try to sound like someone else, but ended up getting more Freddy Mercury comparisons that night. He concludes that he has accepted he will never be able to escape it and has embraced it.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with three individuals seated at a table. The overall setting suggests a casual yet professional talk show environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a male speaker commenting on being compared to someone great in their field, then describes auditioning for a Queen tribute and performing on Ellen. The speaker then notes their initial audition video was uploaded in September 2011, with Ellen's people contacting them by early October. They conclude with a humorous comment about experiencing a viral video.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with three individuals seated at a table. The man on the right, wearing a black leather jacket, is the focal point, engaging in conversation with the woman in the middle, who is dressed in a patterned dress. The man on the left, in a dark suit, listens attentively. The background is adorned with plants and a television screen displaying a live concert performance. The atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the man in the leather jacket gesturing expressively while speaking. The logo "The Cafe" is visible in the bottom left corner, indicating the show's title. The setting is well-lit, with a modern and inviting ambiance, enhanced by the presence of greenery and decorative elements. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the hosts and the guest, highlighting the lively and engaging nature of the talk show.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing how his wife said she lost her husband for a few weeks because he was constantly on YouTube, then expresses relief that the feedback he received was mostly positive. A second female speaker then mentions how people now recognize his voice and compare it to someone else’s. The first male speaker admits to initial reluctance to audition, citing his own band and their relative success with radio play, fearing that joining Queen would disrupt it. He recalls feeling conflicted, worried about impacting his bandmates' lives, but his wife encouraged him, saying he was "born for this." The overall speaking tone is conversational and reflective, creating an atmosphere of relaxed storytelling.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with a modern and cozy atmosphere, highlighted by the presence of potted plants and a stylish backdrop. The host, a man in a dark suit, and a woman in a patterned dress, are seated at a table with a coffee mug and a glass of water, engaging in conversation with a guest, a man in a black leather jacket. The guest, who is the focus of the video, is seen speaking and gesturing with his hands, indicating an animated discussion. The set includes a large screen displaying a band performance, adding to the entertainment vibe. The logo "The Cafe" is visible, suggesting the name of the show. The interaction between the host, the guest, and the woman is dynamic, with the guest often being the center of attention as he speaks and the others listen attentively. The overall setting is warm and inviting, with a blend of casual and professional elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker saying, "you know, thought it was." Another male speaker responds with "Collect and turn." He then asks "How has life changed? It must be phenomenal." The first speaker responds that it's still music and that it's playing music people recognize. He says it's a rush to play songs that everyone knows just as well as you do. He contrasts that with when you're in your own band doing your own music. He mentions that you have your core fans, but there's also a huge part of the audience that you're trying to sell your music to because they've never heard it before.

events_list.audio_caption: Two speakers, male and female, engage in a conversation about the enduring appeal of the band Queen, noting their music's presence in the "zeitgeist for 40 years." The male speaker mentions ending performances with "We Are the Champions" and "We Will Rock You," eliciting a "standing ovation." The female speaker agrees, emphasizing that Queen has "so many feel-good songs."

events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a conversation between two people, presumably an interviewer and interviewee. The interviewer prompts the interviewee to share a story about a performance on Ellen. In response, the interviewee describes the experience as cool and Ellen as sweet, noting it felt like a TV studio. The interviewee also recalls the experience as being somewhat of a blur.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker reflecting on touring with Roger Taylor from the original Queen band. He describes Taylor's involvement, stating he's heavily involved with the Queen Extravaganza, clarifying that Taylor was never in the band but is at the helm. The speaker conveys a friendly, appreciative tone. His comments are followed by a female speaker's brief comment about touring with Roger Taylor.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a lively discussion among three individuals seated at a table in a modern studio setting. The person on the left, dressed in a dark suit and white shirt, listens attentively with hands clasped. The woman in the middle, wearing a patterned blouse, gestures animatedly as she speaks, holding a pen and a notepad. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female interviewer speaking in an excited tone, setting up a question about a film called "Bohemian Rhapsody" and an actor playing Freddie Mercury. She then asks the interviewee about his involvement in the film's music. A male speaker responds in a conversational tone, mentioning being asked to be part of the film. He confirms that the "voice of Freddie will be a mixture" of Freddie Mercury, the actor, and himself. The female interviewer then expresses surprise, and the male speaker agrees it's a secret. Another male voice pipes in, playfully asking if they can get more information. This male voice continues speaking, recalling the speaker's knack for impersonating George Michael. He asks if the interviewee can provide more "secrets." The interviewee shares that he learned how to sing falsetto from listening to "New Kids on the Block", mentioning Jordan Knight as one of his heroes. He lists Jeff Buckley and Richard Marx as additional influences. The second male voice excitedly asks for "a little Right Here Waiting", revealing he is a fan. The speaker acknowledges the listener's fandom, stating that the musician is a great songwriter.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scene from a talk show, featuring three individuals seated at a table. The man on the left is dressed in a dark suit, the woman in the middle wears a floral top, and the man on the right sports a black leather jacket. They are engaged in a conversation, with the man in the leather jacket appearing to speak. The background is adorned with shelves containing plants and decorative items, creating a cozy atmosphere. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man in the leather jacket, emphasizing his expressions as he speaks. The video then shifts to a performance setting, showcasing a man playing the piano on stage, illuminated by dramatic lighting and surrounded by smoke effects. The text "FEATURING THE GREATEST" appears, followed by "THE ULTIMATE QUEEN CELEBRATION," indicating a tribute to the band Queen. The video captures the energy of the live performance, with the man singing passionately into a microphone, and concludes with a shot of the audience, their silhouettes visible against the bright stage lights, celebrating the tribute.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with two speakers, one female and one male, in a friendly, conversational tone. The female speaker introduces a show called "The Ultimate Queen Celebration" and asks about it. The male speaker responds, describing the show as a greatest hits performance with high energy. He highlights the flexibility in the set list, mentioning the inclusion of songs that Queen didn't record. This is followed by the female speaker, reacting with excitement. Lastly, the male speaker continues to discuss the set list. A cymbal crash is briefly heard after the female speaker reacts to the show.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black leather jacket with a quilted design, seated in a studio setting with a backdrop of shelves adorned with potted plants. He is engaged in a conversation, gesturing with his hands and occasionally touching his face, indicating a thoughtful or expressive demeanor. The studio environment is modern and well-lit, with a warm color palette that includes shades of peach and beige. In the background, a television screen displays the text "ULTIMATEQUEENDOWNUNDER.COM," suggesting a promotional or informational context related to the show. The man's attire and the studio's decor contribute to a casual yet professional atmosphere, typical of a talk show or interview setting. The video captures the man's dynamic expressions and gestures, emphasizing his engagement in the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing Queen as one of the only bands that could fill two hours of music with "all greatest hits." He mentions "Bohemian Rhapsody," "Under Pressure," "Fat Bottom Girls," "Tie Your Mother Down," and "I Want To Break Free," implying that, if it's a great song, it's in the show. This is followed by an affirmative response from a second speaker, then the first speaker adds, "awesome, so many good songs."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a talk show set with three individuals seated at a table. The man on the left, dressed in a dark suit and white shirt, and the woman in the middle, wearing a patterned blouse, are engaged in conversation with the man on the right, who is wearing a black leather jacket. The background includes shelves with potted plants and a television screen displaying a performance. The logo "The Café" is visible in the bottom left corner, indicating the show's title. The atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the participants actively listening and responding to each other. The man in the leather jacket is seen gesturing with his hand, suggesting he is making a point or sharing a story. The setting is well-lit, with a modern and inviting ambiance, enhanced by the presence of greenery and decorative elements. The video captures the dynamic interaction among the guests, highlighting their expressions and body language as they engage in the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a female speaker asking if the other person likes the song "Don't Stop Me Now." A male speaker responds in the affirmative, calling it his favorite. The female expresses excitement and mentions it's her all-time favorite for motivation. The male speaker lists other favorite songs, including "Under Pressure" and "Love of My Life", but agrees that "Don't Stop Me Now" is a top favorite. The female speaker expresses gratitude for their chat and anticipation for a later performance.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two hosts seated at a table in a studio setting, engaging in a conversation. The male host, dressed in a dark suit and white shirt, and the female host, wearing a patterned blouse, are positioned in front of a backdrop that includes a refrigerator and shelves adorned with decorative items. The female host holds a white mug with the logo 'The Cafe' on it. Throughout the video, the hosts use hand gestures to emphasize their points, with the male host frequently gesturing while speaking and the female host listening attentively. The table in front of them holds various items, including papers, pens, and a glass of water. A lower third graphic appears, displaying the text 'ticketek.co.nz' and 'ticketmaster.co.nz,' indicating a sponsorship or advertisement. The video concludes with a graphic displaying 'The Cafe' logo and the text 'WEEKDAYS 9AM,' indicating the show's schedule. The overall atmosphere is professional and conversational, typical of a morning talk show.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a woman speaking in an enthusiastic and informative tone about a performance by "Matar" celebrating the Queen, taking place in Auckland and Christchurch. She mentions "Ticketmaster" and "Ticketek" for details. A male speaker then responds, also in an enthusiastic tone, highlighting the performance's name, "You Take My Breath Away", noting that rehearsals have been great. Upbeat pop music, with an inspirational and triumphant mood, plays in the background as the woman concludes, mentioning that more will come after a chat with "Holly".
